deathtouch.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

double strike.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first‑strike and regular combat damage.)

enchant.text: Enchant — [the enchanted permanent type] (This Aura enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)

equip.text: Equip [cost] (Attach this to target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery.)

first strike.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

flash.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

flying.text: Flying (This creature can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.)

haste.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

hexproof.text: Hexproof (This permanent can’t be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

indestructible.text: Indestructible (Effects that say “destroy” don’t destroy this.)

lifelink.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

menace.text: Menace (This creature can’t be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

reach.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

shroud.text: Shroud (This permanent can’t be the target of any spells or abilities.)

trample.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it’s attacking.)

vigilance.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn’t cause this creature to tap.)

cascade.text: Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card with lesser mana value. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost.)

madness.text: Madness [cost] (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

ninjutsu.text: Ninjutsu [cost] ([cost], Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)

escape.text: Escape [cost] (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost by exiling other cards from your graveyard.)

embalm.text: Embalm [cost] ([Cost], Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that’s a copy of it, except it’s a white Zombie with no mana cost. Embalm only as a sorcery.)

eternalize.text: Eternalize [cost] ([Cost], Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a 4/4 black Zombie token with no mana cost. Eternalize only as a sorcery.)

mutate.text: Mutate [cost] (If you cast this spell for its mutate cost, put it over or under target non-Human creature you own. They mutate into the creature on top plus all abilities from under it.)

modular.text: Modular N (This creature enters the battlefield with N +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

persist.text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner’s control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

undying.text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner’s control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

aftermath.text: Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)

suspend.text: Suspend N—[cost] (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay [cost] and exile it with N time counters. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

foretell.text: Foretell [cost] (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it later for its foretell cost.)

bestow.text: Bestow [cost] (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it’s an Aura spell with enchant creature. If it’s not attached to a creature, it becomes a creature again.)

awaken.text: Awaken N—[cost] (If you cast this spell for [cost], also put N +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste.)

dash.text: Dash [cost] (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and return it from the battlefield to its owner’s hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

riot.text: Riot (This creature enters the battlefield with your choice of a +1/+1 counter or haste.)

mentor.text: Mentor (Whenever this creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target attacking creature with lesser power.)

protection.text: Protection from [quality] (This can’t be damaged, enchanted, equipped, blocked or targeted by anything [quality].)

ward.text: Ward [cost] (Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays [cost].)

flashback.text: Flashback [cost] (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cycling.text: Cycling [cost] ([Cost], Discard this card: Draw a card.)

buyback.text: Buyback [cost] (You may pay an additional [cost] as you cast this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as it resolves.)

kicker.text: Kicker [Cost] (You may pay an additional [cost] as you cast this spell. If you do, [effect].)

convoke.text: Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature’s color.)

affinity.text: Affinity for [type] (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each [type] you control.)

prowl.text: Prowl [cost] (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player with a [subtype] this turn.)

spectacle.text: Spectacle [Cost] (You may cast this card for its spectacle cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)

evoke.text: Evoke [cost] (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

split second.text: Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can’t cast spells or activate abilities that aren’t mana abilities.)

unleash.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter. It can’t block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

overload.text: Overload [cost] (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of “target” with “each.”)

scavenge.text: Scavenge [cost] ([Cost], Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card’s power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

soulbond.text: Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired as long as you control both.)

morph.text: Morph [cost] (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

megamorph.text: Megamorph [cost] (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost with a +1/+1 counter.)

exploit.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)

intimidate.text: Intimidate (This creature can’t be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

extort.text: Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)

vanishing.text: Vanishing N (This permanent enters with N time counters. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove one. Sacrifice it when the last is removed.)

fading.text: Fading N (This permanent enters with N fade counters. Remove one at the beginning of your upkeep. Sacrifice it when the last is removed.)

storm.text: Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each other spell cast this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

myriad.text: Myriad (When this creature attacks, for each opponent other than defending player, create a copy that’s tapped and attacking that opponent or a planeswalker they control. Exile the copies at end of combat.)

renown.text: Renown N (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn’t renowned, put N +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)

prowess.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

changeling.text: Changeling (This card is every creature type.)

outlast.text: Outlast [cost] ([Cost]: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Activate only as a sorcery.)

rebound.text: Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.)

miracle.text: Miracle [cost] (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it’s the first card you drew this turn.)

transmute.text: Transmute [cost] ([Cost], Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

graft.text: Graft N (This creature enters the battlefield with N +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)

forecast.text: Forecast — [Cost], Reveal this card from your hand: [Effect]. Activate only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

replicate.text: Replicate [cost] (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

recover.text: Recover [cost] (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay [cost]. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

soulshift.text: Soulshift N (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with mana value N or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

level up.text: Level up [cost] ([Cost]: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)

horsemanship.text: Horsemanship (This creature can’t be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

shadow.text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)

banding.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. You choose how combat damage is assigned.)

cumulative upkeep.text: Cumulative upkeep [cost] (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent. Then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

meld.text: Meld (You may meld two specific cards if you both own and control them. They form a single oversized card with combined characteristics.)

crew.text: Crew N (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power N or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

assist.text: Assist (Another player can help you cast this spell. They can pay up to half of its mana cost.)

devour.text: Devour N (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. It enters the battlefield with N +1/+1 counters for each creature sacrificed.)

tribute.text: Tribute N (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent may put N +1/+1 counters on it. If they don’t, [effect].)

dredge.text: Dredge N (If you would draw a card, you may instead put exactly N cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

delve.text: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)

emerge.text: Emerge [cost] (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature’s mana value.)

escalate.text: Escalate [cost] (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)

cipher.text: Cipher (Then you may exile this spell encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

splice.text: Splice onto Arcane [cost] (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card’s effects to that spell.)

conspire.text: Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it.)

entwine.text: Entwine [cost] (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

epic.text: Epic (For the rest of the game, you can’t cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability.)

hideaway.text: Hideaway N (This enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top N cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom. You may play the exiled card later under certain conditions.)

fabricate.text: Fabricate N (When this creature enters the battlefield, put N +1/+1 counters on it or create N 1/1 Servo artifact creature tokens.)

sweep.text: Sweep — Return any number of [type]s you control to their owner’s hand. [Effect per card returned.]

transform.text: Transform (Turn a double-faced card to its other side. This action is often linked to triggers or conditions.)

underdog.text: Underdog — If you have less life than an opponent, [effect].

void.text: Void — If a nonland permanent left the battlefield this turn or a spell was warped this turn, [effect].

double.text: Double — When this permanent enters, double a certain stat, value, or count. (Appears on specific cards with alternate effects.)

adapt.text: Adapt N — [Cost]: If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put N +1/+1 counters on it.

basic landcycling.text: Basic landcycling [Cost] — Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

casualty.text: Casualty N — As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power N. If you do, it triggers an additional effect.

channel.text: Channel — [Cost], Discard this card: [Effect]. Activate only as a sorcery.

chroma.text: Chroma — Effect is based on count of colored mana symbols among permanents you control.

converge.text: Converge — Effect is based on number of colors of mana spent to cast this spell.

desertwalk.text: Desertwalk — This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls a Desert.

dethrone.text: Dethrone — Whenever this creature attacks the player with the greatest life total (or tied), put a +1/+1 counter on it.

devoid.text: Devoid — This card is colorless, regardless of its mana cost.

eminence.text: Eminence — While this is on the battlefield, if it’s not on the battlefield, you get an effect as long as you control it.

encore.text: Encore [Cost] (Exile this card from your graveyard. For each opponent, create a token copy that attacks that opponent this turn if able. Sacrifice them at end of combat. Activate only as a sorcery.)

evolve.text: Evolve — When a creature with greater power or toughness enters under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.

exalted.text: Exalted — Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

explore.text: Explore — Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land card. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Then you may put that card into your graveyard.

forestcycling.text: Forestcycling [Cost] — Discard this card: Search library for a Forest, put it into your hand.

forestwalk.text: Forestwalk — This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.

hellbent.text: Hellbent — Effect is active if you have no cards in hand.

imprint.text: Imprint — Exile a card to grant abilities to a permanent as long as it remains exiled.

islandwalk.text: Islandwalk — This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.

join forces.text: Join forces — Players in turn order may pay any amount of mana; total mana increases effect symmetrically.

landcycling.text: Landcycling [Cost] — Discard this card: Search library for a land card, put it into your hand.

radiance.text: Radiance — Target something, effect applies to all permanents of same type that share a color with that target.

strive.text: Strive — You may pay extra as you cast this spell to target additional targets.

support.text: Support — Put +1/+1 counter on target creature and/or another creature.

swampcycling.text: Swampcycling [Cost] — Discard this card: Search library for a Swamp, put it into your hand.

swampwalk.text: Swampwalk — This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.

vote.text: Vote — Players choose among options; result based on majority, sometimes with multiple votes allowed.

manifest.text: Manifest (Put a card from your library onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. It can be turned face up if it’s a creature card.)

daybound.text: Daybound — If a player casts no spells during their own turn, the day becomes night; transforms related cards.

nightbound.text: Nightbound (If a player cast no spells during their own turn, it becomes night next turn.)

modified.text: Modified — A creature you control is modified if it has a counter on it, is equipped, or is enchanted by an Aura you control.

impending.text: Impending N — [cost]: This permanent enters with N time counters and isn't a creature until the last is removed. At the beginning of your end step, remove a time counter.

spree.text: Spree — As you cast this spell, choose one or more modes. You can’t choose any mode more than once. Each chosen mode has an additional cost that must be paid. If you cast this spell without paying its mana cost, you must still pay the additional costs. The spell’s mana value is based only on its mana cost.

plot.text: Plot [cost] — As a sorcery, you may pay [cost] and exile this card from your hand plotted. On a later turn, you may cast it from exile without paying its mana cost, only as a sorcery. Cards that become plotted by any effect follow the same timing and can’t be cast the same turn they became plotted.

saddle.text: Saddle N — Activate only as a sorcery. Tap any number of untapped creatures you control other than this creature with total power N or greater: This Mount becomes saddled until end of turn. Other abilities on this card may refer to it being saddled.

umbra armor.text: Umbra armor — If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead destroy this Aura and remove all damage from that creature. (New name for the mechanic previously called totem armor.)

freerunning.text: Freerunning [cost] — An alternative cost you may pay to cast this spell if earlier in the turn an Assassin you controlled or a commander you controlled dealt combat damage to a player. Paying the freerunning cost doesn’t change the spell’s mana value.

offspring.text: Offspring [cost] — As you cast this creature, you may pay its offspring cost. When it enters, create a 1/1 token copy of it (same name, types, mana cost/value, and abilities, but power/toughness 1/1).

gift.text: Gift [effect] — As you cast this spell, you may promise a gift to one opponent. They receive the gift when the spell resolves or the permanent enters. Additional effects may depend on whether a gift was promised.

manifest dread.text: Manifest dread — Look at the top two cards of your library. Manifest one face down as a 2/2 creature and put the other into your graveyard. (A manifested creature card can be turned face up by paying its mana cost as a special action.)

start your engines!.text: Start your engines! — When you first control a permanent with start your engines!, your speed becomes 1. Whenever one or more opponents lose life during your turn, if your speed is less than 4, increase it by 1 (only once each turn).

max speed.text: Max speed — As long as your speed is 4, this permanent has the listed ability.

exhaust.text: Exhaust — Activated abilities that can only be used once per object. Often marked by a counter or token creation. If the permanent leaves and re-enters, it is a new object and the exhaust ability can be used again.

endure.text: Endure N — When a creature with endure N enters the battlefield or otherwise gains endure N, choose one: put N +1/+1 counters on that creature, or create an N/N white Spirit creature token. If the endure ability resolves while the creature isn’t on the battlefield, create the Spirit token instead.

renew.text: Renew — An activated ability usable only from your graveyard. As part of the cost, exile the card. Effects typically add +1/+1 counters or grant other bonuses.

mobilize.text: Mobilize N — Whenever this creature attacks, create N 1/1 red Warrior creature tokens tapped and attacking. Sacrifice those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

harmonize.text: Harmonize [cost] — You may cast this card from your graveyard by paying its harmonize cost. If you tap an untapped creature you control while casting it, reduce the generic portion of the cost by that creature’s power.

job select.text: Job Select — When an Equipment with job select enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Hero creature token, then attach that Equipment to the newly created token.

tiered.text: Tiered [cost] — This keyword appears on modal spells with three different modes. You choose one mode and pay its additional cost. Mana value is based only on the card’s mana cost, not any additional cost.

warp.text: Warp [cost] (You may cast this spell for its warp cost. If you do, it enters the battlefield. At the beginning of the next end step, exile it. You may later cast it from exile for its mana cost.)

station.text: Station — [Ability] Tap an untapped creature you control: Put charge counters equal to that creature’s power on this permanent. Activate only as a sorcery. When a threshold is reached, this permanent becomes a creature with abilities.

spacecraft.text: Spacecraft — A new artifact subtype. Many spacecraft have station abilities that let them transform into artifact creatures once enough charge counters are placed.

planet.text: Planet — A new land subtype. Planets often provide unique mana abilities or effects tied to their planetary type.

cast.text: To cast a spell, you put it on the stack, choose modes, targets, and pay its mana and additional costs. It then resolves or gets countered.

counter.text: To counter a spell or ability is to cancel it before it resolves. A countered spell goes to the graveyard.

create.text: To create a token is to put it onto the battlefield. Tokens can be creatures, treasures, clues, food, etc.

destroy.text: To destroy a permanent is to put it into its owner’s graveyard. Indestructible permanents cannot be destroyed.

discard.text: To discard a card is to put it from your hand into your graveyard. Some effects require discarding as a cost or effect.

exile.text: To exile a card is to put it outside the game. It stays exiled unless another effect brings it back.

play.text: To play a land or cast a spell is to put it into action. Playing a land doesn’t use the stack.

regenerate.text: To regenerate is to prevent a creature from dying. The next time it would be destroyed, it taps and is removed from combat instead.

reveal.text: To reveal a card is to show it to all players, usually from your hand or the top of your library.

sacrifice.text: To sacrifice a permanent is to put it into its owner's graveyard. Sacrificing can’t be prevented.

shuffle.text: To shuffle means to randomize the order of cards in a library or other zone. Often done after searches.

tap.text: To tap a card is to turn it sideways to indicate it’s been used. Commonly used for mana or attacking.

untap.text: To untap is to rotate a tapped card back to its upright position. Happens during the untap step or via effects.

surveil.text: Surveil N (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number into your graveyard and the rest back on top in any order.)

connive.text: Connive (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

venture into the dungeon.text: Venture into the dungeon (Enter the first room of a dungeon or advance to the next room if already inside one.)

exert.text: Exert (When you exert a creature, it won’t untap during your next untap step. In exchange, it usually gets a bonus.)

investigate.text: Investigate (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with '2, Sacrifice this: Draw a card.')

proliferate.text: Proliferate (Choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters, then give each another of those counters.)

mill.text: Mill N (Put the top N cards of a player’s library into their graveyard.)

learn.text: Learn (You may reveal a Lesson card from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

scry.text: Scry N (Look at the top N cards of your library. Put any number on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)

populate.text: Populate (Create a token that’s a copy of a creature token you control.)

detain.text: Detain (Until your next turn, target nonland permanent an opponent controls can’t attack, block, or activate its abilities.)

amass.text: Amass N (Put N +1/+1 counters on an Army you control. If you don’t control one, create a 0/0 black Army creature token first.)

incubate.text: Incubate N (Create an Incubator token with N +1/+1 counters. You may transform it later into a 0/0 Phyrexian artifact creature.)

clash.text: Clash (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts it on top or bottom. Higher mana value wins the clash.)

fateseal.text: Fateseal N (Look at the top N cards of an opponent’s library. You may put any number of them on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)

planeswalk.text: Planeswalk (Move to a new plane card. Triggers planechase abilities.)

time travel.text: Time travel (Un-set only: advance or rewind turns. For silver-border formats only.)

set in motion.text: Set in motion (Start a phenomenon card’s effect at the beginning of a Planechase game.)

abandon.text: Abandon (Move away from the current plane card without triggering a planeswalk effect.)

assemble.text: Assemble (Put a Contraption card into one of your sprockets.)

bolster.text: Bolster N (Choose a creature you control with the least toughness and put N +1/+1 counters on it.)

cloak.text: Cloak (To cloak a card is to put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature with ward {2}. It can be turned face up if it's a creature card.)

forage.text: Forage — As an additional cost, either exile three cards from your graveyard or sacrifice a Food. Triggered abilities that care about 'whenever you forage' only look for this instruction, not generic exiling or sacrificing.

open an attraction.text: Open an Attraction (Reveal cards from your attraction deck until you reveal one that isn’t already open. Put it onto the battlefield.)

roll to visit your attractions.text: Roll to visit your Attractions (At the beginning of your main phase, roll a six-sided die to see which attractions you visit.)

activate.text: Activate — See rule 601.2: Pay costs to activate an activated ability; put it on the stack.

attach.text: Attach — The action of putting an Aura or Equipment onto a permanent.

exchange.text: Exchange — Swap control or characteristics of two permanent or cards as instructed.

fight.text: Fight — Two target creatures deal damage equal to their power to each other.

collect evidence.text: Collect evidence — Arena-specific: Create a Clue token.

discover.text: Discover — Arena-specific: Reveal cards until you find a nonland, then put it into your hand.

demonstrate.text: Demonstrate — When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent. That player also copies the spell. Players may choose new targets for their copies.

goad.text: Goad — Until your next turn, this creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.

behold.text: Behold X — As you cast a spell with behold, either reveal a X card from your hand or choose a X you control. The spell checks whether you beheld a X for additional effects.

behold a dragon.text: Behold a Dragon (As an additional cost or condition on some spells, either choose a Dragon you control or reveal a Dragon card from your hand. Some effects check whether you beheld a Dragon.)

web-slinging.text: Web-slinging [cost] (You may cast this spell for its web-slinging cost if you return a tapped creature you control to its owner's hand. Returning the tapped creature is part of the cost. This does not change when you can cast the spell.)

enweb.text: Enweb [cost] (You may cast this spell for its enweb cost if you return a tapped creature you control to its owner's hand. Returning the tapped creature is part of the cost. This does not change when you can cast the spell.)

mayhem.text: Mayhem [cost] (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its mayhem cost if you discarded it this turn. Normal timing rules apply.)

infinity.text: Infinity (∞) — This permanent has the listed ability only while it is harnessed.

landfall.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, [effect].

delirium.text: Delirium — If there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, [effect].

raid.text: Raid — If you attacked with a creature this turn, [effect].

morbid.text: Morbid — If a creature died this turn, [effect].

metalcraft.text: Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, [effect].

spell mastery.text: Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant or sorcery cards in your graveyard, [effect].

ferocious.text: Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, [effect].

formidable.text: Formidable — If creatures you control have total power 8 or greater, [effect].

fateful hour.text: Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, [effect].

domain.text: Domain — Effect based on number of basic land types among lands you control.

constellation.text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, [effect].

heroic.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets this creature, [effect].

threshold.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, [effect].

battalion.text: Battalion — Whenever this and at least two other creatures attack, [effect].

undergrowth.text: Undergrowth — Effect based on number of creature cards in your graveyard.

magecraft.text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, [effect].

pack tactics.text: Pack tactics — If you attack with creatures with total power 6 or greater, [effect].

coven.text: Coven — If you control three or more creatures with different powers, [effect].

adamant.text: Adamant — If at least three mana of the same color was spent to cast this spell, [effect].

alliance.text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, [effect].

celebration.text: Celebration — If two or more nonland permanents entered the battlefield under your control this turn, [effect].

descend.text: Descend — If a permanent card was put into your graveyard this turn, [effect].

fathomless descent.text: Fathomless Descent — Effects based on the number of permanent cards in your graveyard.

corrupted.text: Corrupted — If an opponent has three or more poison counters, [effect].

survival.text: Survival — If you control no other creatures, [effect].

paradox.text: Paradox — If you cast a spell from anywhere other than your hand this turn, [effect].

enrage.text: Enrage — Whenever this creature is dealt damage, [effect].

will of the planeswalkers.text: Will of the Planeswalkers — Starting with you, each player votes for chaos or stability. Then effects happen based on the majority vote.

secret council.text: Secret council — Players vote in secret, then reveal simultaneously. Effects trigger based on vote outcomes.

addendum.text: Addendum — If you cast this spell during your main phase, it gains an additional effect.

choose a background.text: Choose a background — You select a Background enchantment to pair with a partner creature.

revolt.text: Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, [effect].

teamwork.text: Teamwork — Whenever this creature and another attack together, [effect].

tempting offer.text: Tempting offer — When you cast this spell, each opponent may copy it and choose a target. For each one who does, [bonus effect].

will of the council.text: Will of the Council — Players vote for options; the majority determines the outcome, but minority options may still trigger.

council's dilemma.text: Council's dilemma — When this enters, players vote for options; effects resolve based on votes.

grandeur.text: Grandeur — Discard another card with the same name: [effect].

valiant.text: Valiant — Ability word marking abilities that trigger whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability you control.

flurry.text: Flurry — Ability word marking abilities that trigger when you cast your second spell each turn.

heist.text: Heist (Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn if you attacked this turn.)

perpetual.text: Perpetual (Effects with this keyword apply permanently, even across zone changes.)

spellbook.text: Spellbook (When triggered, you may choose one of several predefined cards to conjure into your hand.)

intensity.text: Intensity — An Arena-only numeric value that starts at a defined number (Starting Intensity) and increases as specified by the card. The card’s effects scale with its current intensity, which updates visually in-game.

special.adventure: Adventure — A special card type allowing you to cast one half (the Adventure instant or sorcery) before the creature. After casting the Adventure part, the creature card is exiled and then can be cast. Common in Theros Beyond Death and Lord of the Rings (2020).
special.monarch: Monarch is a designation a player can have. At the beginning of your end step, if you're the monarch, you draw a card. A player becomes the monarch by dealing combat damage to the current monarch.
special.initiative: The Initiative is a designation a player can have. When you take the Initiative, you venture into the Undercity. If you already have the Initiative, you instead venture deeper. The Initiative can be stolen by dealing combat damage to the player who currently has it.
special.city blessing: The City's Blessing is a status you gain once you control ten or more permanents. Once you have it, you keep it for the rest of the game. Some cards have Ascend and become stronger if you have the City’s Blessing.
special.commit a crime: Commit a crime — You commit a crime as you cast a spell, activate an ability, or put a triggered ability on the stack that targets an opponent, a permanent, spell, or ability an opponent controls, or a card in an opponent’s graveyard. It counts as committed when the action is initiated, regardless of whether it resolves.
special.outlaws: Outlaws — A permanent with one or more of the following creature types: Assassin, Mercenary, Pirate, Rogue, or Warlock. “An outlaw you control” refers only to permanents on the battlefield.
special.kindred: Kindred — Card type name replacing the former ‘tribal’ card type; allows noncreature cards to have creature types. Older tribal cards are updated to kindred.
special.expend: Expend — A new rules term that tracks the total amount of mana you have spent to cast spells during the current turn. Cards may check if you expended your Nth mana; this only triggers once per turn at that exact payment. Includes mana spent on additional and alternative costs.
special.rooms: Rooms — A new subtype of enchantments that function like split permanents. Each half is called a door. When you cast a Room, choose one door to unlock. The other stays locked. Later, you may unlock another locked door as a sorcery by paying its mana cost. Unlocking is a special action that doesn’t use the stack. A Room on the battlefield has the characteristics of its unlocked doors.
special.speed: Speed — A player designation tracked for the whole game. Starts at 0. Becomes 1 the first time you control a permanent with start your engines!. Can increase up to 4. Cards may check or care about your speed value.
special.omen: Omen — A noncreature spell inset on a creature card. When cast as an Omen (instead of casting the creature), it's cast as an instant or sorcery, and when it resolves it is shuffled back into its owner's library instead of going to the graveyard. Introduced in Tarkir: Dragonstorm (2025).
special.harnessed: Harnessed — A designation a permanent can have after you harness it. The ∞ ability functions only while it is harnessed. Copies are not harnessed. If it leaves the battlefield and returns, it is no longer harnessed.

special_counters.poison: Poison Counter — A counter a player can have. A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game. (This is a state-based action.)
special_counters.shield: Shield Counter — If this permanent would be destroyed or dealt damage, remove a shield counter instead.
special_counters.stun: Stun Counter — (Can be placed on untapped permanents.) If a tapped permanent with one or more stun counters would untap, it stays tapped and one stun counter is removed from it instead.
special_counters.finality: Finality Counter — If a permanent with a finality counter would die, exile it instead.
special_counters.rad: Rad Counter — At the beginning of your precombat main phase, if you have any rad counters, mill that many cards. For each nonland card milled this way, you lose 1 life and remove one rad counter.

special_tokens.blood: Blood Token — Artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.” Introduced in Innistrad: Crimson Vow (2021).
special_tokens.map: Map Token — Artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Target creature you control explores.” Introduced in The Lost Caverns of Ixalan (2023).
special_tokens.treasure: Treasure Token — Artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” Evergreen since Ixalan (2017).
special_tokens.gold: Gold Token — Artifact token with “Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” Similar to Treasure but activation doesn’t require tapping.
special_tokens.clue: Clue Token — Artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.” Created by Investigate and related effects.
special_tokens.food: Food Token — Artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.” First appeared in Throne of Eldraine (2019).
special_tokens.incubator: Incubator Token — Artifact token with “{2}: Transform this artifact.” It transforms into a 0/0 Phyrexian artifact creature with N +1/+1 counters on it.
special_tokens.powerstone: Powerstone Token — Artifact token with “{T}: Add {C}. This mana can’t be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.” Introduced in The Brothers' War (2022).
special_tokens.shard: Shard Token — Enchantment token with “{2}, Sacrifice this enchantment: Scry 1, then draw a card.” Created by the Constellation mechanic (Kaldheim Commander decks).
special_tokens.role: Role Token — Enchantment Aura token with various keywords and abilities. Created by cards in Wilds of Eldraine (2023). Only one Role per creature per controller.
special_tokens.junk: Junk Token — Artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn.”
special_tokens.meteorite: Meteorite Token — Artifact token with “When Meteorite enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.” and “{T}: Add one mana of any color.”
special_tokens.lander: Lander Token — Artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this token: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.”
special_tokens.munitions: Munitions Token — Artifact token with “When this token leaves the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.”

deathtouch.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

double strike.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first‑strike and regular combat damage.)

enchant.text: Enchant — [the enchanted permanent type] (This Aura enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)

equip.text: Equip [cost] (Attach this to target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery.)

first strike.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

flash.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

flying.text: Flying (This creature can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.)

haste.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

hexproof.text: Hexproof (This permanent can’t be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

indestructible.text: Indestructible (Effects that say “destroy” don’t destroy this.)

lifelink.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

menace.text: Menace (This creature can’t be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

reach.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

scry.text: Scry N (Look at the top N cards of your library. Put any number on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)

shroud.text: Shroud (This permanent can’t be the target of any spells or abilities.)

surveil.text: Surveil N (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number into your graveyard and the rest back on top in any order.)

trample.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it’s attacking.)

vigilance.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn’t cause this creature to tap.)

ward.text: Ward [cost] (Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays [cost].)

deckbuilding.companion: Companion — If your starting deck meets the stated condition, you may cast this card once from outside the game.
deckbuilding.doctor's companion: Doctor's companion — If your starting deck includes The Doctor, you may have two commanders if one has doctor’s companion.
deckbuilding.partner: Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)
deckbuilding.partner with: Partner with [name] (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may search their library for [name], reveal it, put it into their hand, then shuffle.)
deckbuilding.friends forever: Friends forever (You can have two commanders if both have friends forever.)

cursed.text:
Cursed — Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 1/1. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

monster.text:
Monster — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

royal.text:
Royal — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has ward {1}. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

sorcerer.text:
Sorcerer — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has 'Whenever this creature attacks, scry 1.' 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

wicked.text:
Wicked — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1. When this Aura is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

young hero.text:
Young Hero — Enchanted creature has 'Whenever this creature attacks, if its toughness is 3 or less, put a +1/+1 counter on it.' 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

virtuous.text:
Virtuous — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

chef.text:
Chef — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has 'Whenever this creature attacks, create a Food token.' 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

huntsman.text:
Huntsman — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has '{T}: Add {G}.' 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

questing.text:
Questing — Enchanted creature has all abilities of Questing Beast. 
(Enchant creature. If a creature would be enchanted by two or more Role Auras you control, choose one and put the rest into their owners’ graveyards.)

history.name: Modern Horizons 3
history_notes: 'Tribal' cards are retitled to the **kindred** card type. Existing cards are updated accordingly.
'Totem armor' is retitled **umbra armor**; functionality unchanged.
**Emerge** debuts an artifact-sacrifice variant in this set.

history.name: Assassin’s Creed
history_notes: Freerunning debuts as an alternate cost unlocked if an Assassin or commander you controlled dealt combat damage to a player earlier in the turn.

history.name: Bloomburrow
history_notes: Offspring debuts: optional extra cost to make a 1/1 token copy of the creature as it enters.
Gift debuts: additional cost to promise an opponent a benefit, which they receive on resolution or ETB.
Forage debuts: exile three cards from graveyard or sacrifice a Food as an additional cost. Only counts if specifically foraging.
Valiant debuts: ability word marking triggers when your spell/ability targets your own creature.

Expend debuts: new rules term tracking the total mana spent to cast spells each turn; abilities can trigger when you expend your Nth mana, counting all costs including additional or alternative costs.

history.name: Duskmourn: House of Horror
history_notes: Rooms debut as split-style permanents with unlockable halves (doors). Unlocking is a special action, not using the stack.
Manifest dread debuts: look at top two, manifest one as 2/2, graveyard the other. Expands on existing manifest keyword action.

history.name: Innistrad Remastered
history_notes: TDFCs highlighted again: mana value of back face comes from front face, and color is shown via a color indicator.

history.name: Aetherdrift
history_notes: Introduces speed as a tracked player designation (0–4).
Start your engines! is the entry mechanic for gaining speed.
Max speed defined at 4; abilities only function at this cap.
Exhaust introduced: an activated ability usable only once per object (resets if it leaves and re-enters).

history.name: Tarkir: Dragonstorm
history_notes: Surveil promoted to evergreen mechanic in this set.
Omen spells introduced: creature cards with a spell-half Omen; casting that half causes shuffle into library on resolution.
Behold a Dragon cost alias added: additional cost can be reveal or control a Dragon.

history.name: Final Fantasy
history_notes: Saga creatures debut as a type implementation (not a keyword): Enchantment Creature — Saga following Saga chapter rules while functioning as creatures.

history.name: Edge of Eternities
history_notes: Legendary Vehicles and legendary Spacecraft with printed power and toughness are eligible to be commanders starting with this set.
Lander tokens are new artifact tokens with 'Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle' as a sacrifice ability.

history.name: Marvel's Spider-Man
history_notes: MDFCs in this set can transform, but only one-way (front to back). The back face has no transform ability.
A creature is not considered modified by an Aura controlled by an opponent. Any kind of counter counts as modified.
